text: The room and price for the room were reasonable. Rooms are pretty updated and everyone for the most part was super nice and willing to help! We stayed 3 nights and 4 days and never got my room cleaned. First day they blamed it on me because I didn’t call it in since my phone wasn’t working?? Second day they said they would and came back to my room and nothing. Shout out to Alexys who was always so helpful.

title: Bien ubicado
text: Ea un lugar solo para dormir, te ofrecen el desayuno de 6 a 9 pero aparte de que es malisimo no tienen suficientes a las 8:30 no queda nada, cual es el sentido de madrugar a buscar un huevo sintetico si estas de vacaciones, no realizan limpieza en el cuarto me imagino que por un tema de ahorro vinimos 4 noches y nunca limpiario, el aire tiene un tema de ahorro de energia que prende y apaga toda la noche lo que no permite a uno descansar.  Es un hotel economico bien centrico para moverte caminando a todos lados . Tienen estacion de agua y cafe todo el dia, el personal es amable exceptuando la odiosa del desayuno.

title: Definitely recommended
text:
We stayed here for 10 nights in the month of June. The hotel was very centrally located, walking distance to most attractions and the neighborhood felt quite safe. The room and common spaces were clean. TV in the room did not have a streaming option but there's a lot of channels to zap. This hotel also had a fast and reliable wifi. 

Check-in and check-out was so easy and they also helped us store our bags for a few hours after we checked-out. The staff were very sweet and helpful day and night during our stay. Special thanks to hotel staff Keyon, Cynthia, Diana, Ahmed and Oswald! You guys made our stay so comfortable!

title: Impressed with the experience!
text: With such a reasonable rate, I was not expecting the quality of service I received and accomodations at this hotel. I was impressed with the staff's great service, the room was cute and clean, the breakfast, the close off-campus gym access, and the level of COVID-19 precautions. It was a pleasant stay and I recommend the hotel to those looking for a reasonably priced and cute boutique hotel with great service and nice accomodations.

title: Rude reception lady and tiny rooms
text: Stayed at the hotel over the past weekend and was disappointed with the hospitality. Lady at reception Cynthia was unprofessional, rude, and very short-tempered. I would not recommend any of my friends and family traveling to NYC to stay at La Quinta.

title: Not friendly and helpful at the reception
text:
We stayed at this hotel in June. The hotel is clean. The Stuff is unfriendly. The reception lady Cynthia is so rude. 

She is extremely unfriendly from the minute we walked to the door. She is short tempted, rude. She didn’t help us to check it. Cynthia acts like we stay for free at this hotel. 
I was watching her while she served other clients, she chooses whom she wants to be nice and helpful. 

Not recommend to stay because of the hotel stuff

title: Excellent Stay
text:
This was my first time traveling anywhere since March 2020 when Covid started the shut downs in the US. Needless to say my husband and I were a bit apprehensive but I do a lot of research before booking a hotel and this time was no different, The hotel is an a great location close to the Port Authority subway station and from there you can go just about anywhere you want in NY. 
Our room was clean, but be aware you MUST request for your room to be serviced if you want your bed made etc. We were only there for two nights so this wasn't much of an issue. There is coffee, tea and cold water available in the lobby and trust me, when you come back to the hotel after enduring that hot NY summer weather you will be VERY grateful for that water. 
The best part of our hotel stay was Cynthia. She was amazing!!! Extremely helpful and professional. There is no question we asked that she didn't answer. I was mostly impressed on our first morning and seeing Cynthia serving breakfast AND checking in guests at the same time. I know she must have been overwhelmed, but she remained super clam and professional and did everything with a smile on her face. At the end of the trip we requested to speak to the manager to express our sincere gratitude for the service we received and Mr. Ahmed Latif was amazing as well. Not pretentious at all and even gave us a little gift to take back home. We will definitely be back to this hotel on our next visit to NY, especially if Cynthia is there and Mr. Latif is in charge.

title: Review
text: Cynthia and Alexys did an amazing job with the customer service. They made us feel like we was at home in we really enjoyed ourselves. I will definitely come back there in the future. I will be back in September of this year.

title: I would recommend the hotel to friends and family BUT I’d be aware of the cleaning and internet LOTS to be improved in t
text:
I’d recommend the hotel to family and friends but be aware that the cleaning and the internet deserves more attention.
The personnel were GREAT
We were very happy with the location and the reception we’ve received from the employees at the reception, they were always whilling to help.

title: First visit to New York City
text: Cynthia help us a lot amazing experience we are definitely going back again all the staff is amazing and loved thank you so much we are si happy to choose La Quinta Inn & Suite by Wyndham to stay in are first visit

title: First trip to NY
text: I’m super happy I decided to stay here it’s in the middle of everything Times Square is just minutes away food is walking distance no need for a car at all! The subway is foot steps away.This hotel is barely two years old it’s modern and well kept smells new. The neighborhood is clean. The staff at this location provides exceptional customer service Alexis  is awesome! Celine is the best!!! They made sure our stay was comfortable I’d definitely be returning soon.

title: Above and Beyond
text: La Quinta is an exceptional hotel that is clean, within a central and convenient location with a phenomenal staff.  I had an unexpected situation arise where I required a room promptly. Ms. Celine Chen the General Manager went above and beyond to accommodate my needs. She and her staff were courteous, professional and very helpful! I greatly appreciated Ms. Chen's kindness and assistance in helping make a stressful situation more manageable. An extended thank you to Mr. Mohammed who assisted me as well. It was welcoming to encounter such a great staff!

title: Mr. Mora
text: Front desk staff (Diana) is extremely efficient, pleasant and helpful! Overall, La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Time Square South amenities were great and staff were incredibly helpful. Had a great stay!

title: Gran opción excelente atención
text:
El lugar está muy buen ubicado, las instalaciones son bonitas y permanecen aseadas.

El desayuno es muy rico aún que por pandemia algo monótono 

Diana en la recepción es muy amable y habla muy bien español.

title: Great Stay
text: Great hotel location near stores and Times Square. Friendly staff warm and welcoming. Private quiet environment. Clean room nice view. Great shower. Free Breakfast.  Looking forward to staying again. Stay here.

title: Great Experience - Location and service was the best!
text:
We recently visited New York City and stayed at La Quinta Times square. The location of the hotel is great. It is equidistant from the Penn Station and Times square and we could walk everywhere!! 

The staff was very warm, kind and efficient. Everyone made sure that our stay was comfortable. I would definitely go back!

title: WE LOVED IT !!!!
text: The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The room and the hotel as a whole was very clean which was very much appreciated due to the pandemic. Free breakfast provided every morning. Will definitely come again 5 stars!!!

title: Really a Great Stay
text:
We had to come to NYC for family emergency during pandemic - found this hotel online and whether because of pandemic or not, they had great pricing! 

Awesome location that is fifteen minute walk from Times Square and 20 minute walk from Chelsea! 

Space inside the hotel was decent (have stayed at some hotels in Manhattan where you trip over the bed after opening the door to the room!) although we did get the larger king bed. Rooms were clean and decently appointed. Overhead shower with steam doors was really nice! 

There were some limitations on service because of pandemic restrictions but this shouldn’t reflect on the hotel so I won’t mention them in detail. 

One thing I do want to say is that the staff were very attentive. Celine, in particular, went out of her way to connect with us and make us feel very welcome. 

Definitely will be our first choice on our next trip back to the city.

title: Warmest New York Hospitality
text: If there's one thing that is very much commendable about this hotel is the STAFF. They definitely will be there to help you out (well except the guy on night shift; but he was ok) and they go beyond what customer service means.

title: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Time Square South
text: Very warm welcome to the Hotel, very young, friendly, supportive crew, all really nice especially Celine. Very nice stay. The Hotel is near Time Square and you can use Metro, buses. The hotel is very clean and safe, all wearing mask, include Breakfast from 6 to 9. We are very pleased with the attentions, including a map with indications to travel using the Metro.

title: Thank you all
text: Hello again I don't know what happened to the 1st review but I am going to send this one in awesome. A special thanks to miss Rivera and miss Celine M Mr. Ozwald and the rest of staff thank you for being kind to our family

title: Great mid town gem !
text: Fantastic new facility, clean and comfortable. Staff was super friendly and helpful.... I travel for a living and basically live in hotels. This is my new go to place for Manhattan! I would expect to pay double for this level of hotel! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

title: Everything was perfect
text: Everything was perfect. Breakfast was delicios, the room was clean, hotel was good, people was good, location was good, employees were good. We were so happy in new York. Thank you so much for everything.

title: lazy customer service
text:
Terrible, check in process! Mahmoud M. Mahmoud, the acting front desk manager was rude and had no experience in customer service or “Platinum” Rewards Membership. My wife and I are frequent stayers and Mahmoud M, neglected to acknowledge the benefits of the membership, there was a “Problem” for every possible solution as Mahmoud’s lazy customer service caused unnecessary emotional anger and frustration surrounding, my Anniversary gift to my wife. After, several months of COVID. I wanted to give her to have a stress free and effortless experience that he ruined because the credit card was left home and when asked not to “Authorize” the debit until i was able to update the card on file (few hours) that disappeared somehow, as a platinum member. 

My wife was not able to pack small toiletries such as toothpaste, additional soap, and a comb. They made her walk to 8th avenue CVS where it’s a HUB for disgruntled drug addicts and homeless. This was absolutely a horrendous stay. I wasted thousands of points when I could’ve given her a spa day at HOME!! Although my wife made the best of the experience the ”check-in” process and the individual behind the desk made me reluctant to sharing this experience.

title: Great little gem in a convenient location near major transportation hubs. Fabulous staff and clean functional room.
text: I am a local who is dealing with an apartment mishap and needed a refuge from home. This fit the bill. It would be a great stay for anyone but perfect for travelers needing to be close to Penn Station or Port Authority as both are withing walking distance. Small but efficient did the trick for me! Great bed and pillows, strong WiFi, mini fridge, continental breakfast, and VERY clean with great shower. The staff was especially accommodating and helpful and very sweet. Only 3 rooms per floor and very quiet when I was there for people who have a tough time sleeping in NYC. Between the pandemic and the hurricane and my own stressful situation, this was a delightful Refuge.

title: Molto confortevole
text: Hotel rinnovato molto carino e pulito, la posizione è ottima vicinissimo a Times Square e alle principali stazioni metro. Il personale molto cortese, nella hall possibile prendere caffè the e biscotti in qualunque momento. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, molto consigliato considerando i prezzi di New York.

title: Great location, near Penn Station.
text:
very clean new facility!
pleasant helpful desk staff. Lucked out with a Free stay with points still had a great high floor room.
Smallish room but not cramped, but its NYC, so was  actually better than average fro the price level.

title: Un très bon hôtel bien situé
text:
Nous avons séjour pour notre deuxième séjour à NYC dans cet hôtel. Le choix de cet hôtel c'est fait de manière totalement impromptu ayant du changer d'hôtel quelques jours avant notre départ. Et que dire à part que se fut une très bonne surprise. L'hôtel est agréable, le personnel est vraiment serviable, aimable et gentil. L'hôtel est proche de toutes les commodités à pied. 
Le petit déjeuner est très satisfaisant, il faut juste penser à mettre un pull pour aller le prendre car la clim peut être un peu forte dans la pièce mais c'est franchement le seul point négatif à noter. Le café est bon, le jus d'orange est de type Minute Maid donc rien à dire. Sachant que dans certains hôtels le café ou le jus d'orange peuvent faire peur, que la rien à dire. 
L'hôtel offre toute la journée la possibilité de prendre à emporter café, déca, ou thé comme on le veut dans le hall d'entrée et ceux gratuitement. Et l'après midi dès cookies sont cuits par le réceptionniste et proposé à la clientèle toujours gratuitement. 
La chambre en elle-même était de taille juste, elle ne s'est pas révélé trop petite pour deux pendant une semaine, nous avions une chambre donnant sur la rue directement et la rue de l'hôtel est vraiment calme, il ne faut pas avoir peur du bruit, nous n'avons jamais été dérangé durant notre sommeil. Et il faut signaler que la wifi en haut débit est gratuite vraiment dans tout l'hôtel, même dans la chambre, ce qui est vraiment top. 
Bref, un très bon hôtel à choisir sans soucis, je vous le recommande vraiment. Le prix est vraiment bien placé, pour indication, les sept nuits pour deux avec petit déjeuner nous est revue à 953 euros en mi février.

title: Great clean and quiet
text: Not bad at all actually really neat. I did enjoy my stay. I just didn't like how they didn't accept military discount . i found that weird cause wyndham hotels i been to accepts it always and there food is over priced too a can of soda for 4 to 5 dollars is insane. Besides that the stay was great i enjoyed it , it was very clean and there showers where awesome .

title: Great location for walking tourists, clean and new hotel, great service
text: The hotel looks modern and clean like on the pictures. Rooms are not big but for 2 people for 3-4 night sufficient. No smell, no noise (both from street and corridor/other rooms) Breakfast not bad american standard, for European travelers - the breakfasts in US are totally different than in Europe but fine. Coffee (24/7) and tasty cookies (after 5pm) in the lobby! Great location for walking up and down Manhattan, very close to Time Square. Walking distance to Penn Station to get to Newark Airport by train. Great stay!!!

title: Anniversary
text: Excellent Hotel!! The room was small but clean. Hotel staff were very nice and accommodating. The hotel’s location was perfect. There is only 3 or 4 rooms per floor.very quiet. I would definitely stay here again!!!!

title: Excellent Value
text: A gem.    Rooms are small but have everything you need and are very clean and very modern.   Good location.  13 walk to Madison Square Garden.    Excellent restaurant Casa Nonna across the street.  24 hr parking garage also across the street.   Free breakfast with eggs and pancakes or french toast.

title: The Best in Times Square Area
text:
The hotel is brand new everything is fresh and new.
The staff always welcoming me in with a warm welcoming smile. 
The rooms are good size for NYC hotels & The bed was so Comfy.
Hotel near Times Square, Hudson Yards, Madison Square Garden, Subway stations & A lot of Restaurants.

title: Clean, Affordable Hotel in NYC
text: This is a new property and convenient to Times Square, Empire State Building, etc.  Despite being in NYC it was very quiet.  The staff was super friendly and the hotel, as far as cleanliness, was immaculate.  The price was great and much less than I expected to pay in Manhattan.  We look forward to coming back.  The rooms were small but I totally expected that in NYC so didn't find it to be a problem.

title: Spotlessly New
text: This property was a shining example of what a hotel should be. Rooms were not large as most NYC are usually on the small size. Our room was absolutely spotless and quiet. Only three rooms per floor. Breakfast was good.

title: Overcharging
text: The hotel is nice good location but they forgot to make a new booking, we maked one sr booking.com and more 3 nights directely and payed at check in . They forgot to make in the sistem and was calling to leave the room and I had the recit and showed. After they made a overcharging of US$3000,00 , we wee in the subway and return and they sad it was a problem in the sistem . Very mass.

title: Excellent choice of hotel in NY
text: I stayed at the hotel for 17 nights and I really liked the accommodations, the cleanliness of the room and the kindness of the entire team, especially Diana, who always welcomed me with a huge smile on her face that made my day better. Breakfast is good for those who stay at the hotel for a short period, as it is always the same food every day and there were few protein options.

title: New modern unpretentious hotel!
text: Located just off 8th Ave in The Garment District 4 blocks South from Times Square this new 22 story hotel is comfortable great value for mid-town Manhattan.   Rooms are small but well appointed.  The breakfast was better than expected! The staff was very pleasant!

title: The best place to stay south of 42nd street
text: From Checking in to checking out the best customer service period! Staff is genuinely happy to meet and assist you (no fake smile here), staff is very friendly, courteous, professional and accommodating.

title: Clean hotel, fantastic/friendly staff, great value.
text: We were initially fooled when google street view showed it under construction; that's how new it is! The nice clean lobby is indicative of the cleanliness throughout, just as the friendly front desk staff are indicative of the rest of the staff, (breakfast & housekeeping staff included). The hotel breakfast (included) gets you off to a quick start to the day (coffee/tea, OJ, cereal, fruit, pastries, eggs, pancakes/fr. toast). Subway: it's only 4 blocks up to Times Sq - 42 St. Station blue line which has underground walkway to the red and yellow lines as well. Cheap eats on the corner of 38th St. & 8th Ave. for late night include 2 Bros. Pizza by the slice/pie and a great little Wok to Walk. The room is small, but hey folks, it's Manhattan! 4 guest rooms per floor and around 22 floors. We stayed 6 nights. The only thing that would make it better would be the addition of a full length mirror in each room when you're getting fancied up for a night out!

title: Lost belongings
text: Housekeeping has not taken care of our belonging. Following our check out we forgot to pack a pair of boots. We kept the room tidy when we left and used all the bins for trash. The item was not disposed. Housekeeping did not have records of our belongings. We placed two call to verify and were told there was nothing in the room.

title: The best Hotel I've ever visited!
text: I was coming to New York with the intention of proposing to my girlfriend. When I called and informed Mahmoud, the general manager, he was immediately and passionately intent on making this the best possible experience for myself and my now fiance. They made sure the room was perfect placement, style, and nothing was handled without care. Diana was discreet and very enthusiastic in greeting us upon arrival and leading me to Mahmoud who was there on his day off and Ana, the head of housekeeping, who showed me to the room and made sure it was to my liking, set up the room for my proposal even buying extra roses and decorations on her own, and did a more magical job decorating the room than I could ever have imagined! They incorporated items and ideas I hadn't even thought of that made it even more of a "WOW" moment. To put it simply... they made magic. It felt like a fairytale and the hospitality the extended made me feel like they had known me our whole relationship and genuinely cared this was important to me! Not to mention the fact that everytime we walked in or out of the hotel they greeted us with a smile and friendly conversation. I felt like everytime we saw David or Diana at the door it was like being greeted by my own family and that they genuinely enjoyed seeing us. 5/5, 10/10, 100/100!!! If you are in New York stay HERE! Walking distance from anywhere you want to go and they really created the best experience I've ever been a part of! I will not be staying anywhere else. Anytime I come to New York, I will be staying here at the La Quinta of 333 W 38th street!

title: Birthday trip
text: Location was good within walking distance of most things room was small but excellent very clean bed was comfortable breakfast was ok but you can get grate food within walking distance staff was very helpful especially David very nice i had a good time

title: Very Poor Customer Service- Credit Card Scammers- You will be overcharged.
text:
I had a reservation at this hotel for 12/21, unfortunately my mother was seriously ill and at a last minute, per the hotels confirmation to call with any urgencies, I called the hotel explained to the hurried front desk person that my mother was in a serious health crisis and asked to cancel my reservation. She said, no problem, I am sorry to hear this news and I will take care of it. Well she didnt and my mothers limited income credit card was charged a whopping $$377 for a no-show. We had another reservation at the Hilton for additional family and they were kind and gracious to cancel per phone call without a problem. Laquinta is refusing to refund me, charged a credit card without approval and their management does not have the customer service decency to call me or respond to my emails. 
This is not customer service- this is theft and terrible disrespect for the visitors that help this hotel in business.
Buyer beware if they will charge me a room despite me following their directions to call in urgent matters, imagine what they will charge to your card when there is a missing towel or you check out 5 minutes late. Worst customer service I have ever experienced.

title: Wonderful place to stay.
text: Hotel was clean and very convenient to places we wanted to go. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Guest rooms were a little small but we had all the room we needed and we weren't in our room very much. Can't say enough wonderful things about this place. Just GREAT.

title: A comfortable hotel with easy access to many attractions with a friendly staff
text:
My husband and I spent Christmas 2019 at this small non pretentious yet extremely accommodating reasonably priced hotel. We could walk to the hotel from the Port Authority, take the subway to many locations and enjoy the hospitality of the staff- Mahmoud, Bushara, Diana, David and Omar- were all very helpful in providing us everything we needed to make our stay comfortable.
Highly recommend this hotel to anyone not looking for a deluxe accommodation with a heave price tag.
A little homey place in midtown.
Thanks to the staff who helped us during our stay.

title: 100 % recomendable
text: Visitamos Nueva York 1 semana en la previa a las fiestas navideñas y debo reconocer que el hotel es además de cálido y nuevo un espacio de relax después de un día de paseos y muchas actividades. El desayuno es correcto y algo no habitual en los hoteles de NY ... y la atención del personal es maravillosa,siempre dispuestos a resolver cualquier inquietud o inconveniente que surgía.  Recomiendo que visiten La Quinta inn... todo esta súper accesible si les gusta caminar y buscan una buena opción que conjugue precio y calidad hotelera...volvería sin dudas.  Muchas gracias por la atención  recibida.

title: Great stay
text:
My husband and I are on the third of a four night stay. Very nice accommodations. Clean rooms and hotel overall ( new) decorated modern. We are in a King Premier room on the 20th floor- room 2002. Nice view of city lights makes for a great night light. King bed and linens and pillows very comfortable. Housekeeping freshens immaculately each day while we are out. Very nice hot shower, plenty of towels and complimentary toiletries and blow dryer. Coffee maker and refrigerator also in room - 2 complimentary bottled waters daily in your room. Breakfast on the concourse level. Adequate but we opted to eat out mostly instead but I do think it’s nice that they have this ( basic bagels, cereals etc) Hot cookies each afternoon at 5 is also a very nice touch- coffee in the lobby 24 hours. All of these little touches make this place a great value for your money. A few blocks from Penn Station subway line at 34th. We also enjoyed massages on 36th street @ Aquis. Very affordable and worth it after walking all weekend. Love that it was close and clean and a great massage for $50.00 plus tip. My body feels better after working the kinks out.
Overall I will plan on staying here again. Nothing disappointed us in any way. Great spot to explore the city!

title: New but could be better.
text:
Brand new small hotel well located in Midtown. Close to 
Port Authority Bus Terminal and Penn Station. 

Very small lobby with few seating but complimentary tea and coffee (and even cookies).

We travelled with a friend, so we can compare 2 types of rooms.
The standard King room is very small.
No place to open a suitcase, and small bathroom with no space  to put a vanity case or even your toiletries.
The Premier King room is much better in terms of space , especially the bathroom, but still no luggage stand.
We had some issues with the A/C that was pretty noisy, but the 
hotel by itself is very quiet.

The breakfast room located in the basement with no windows is also very small ( roughly 20 seats), so it can be difficult to access during peak hours.
Complimentary Breakfast itself is simple but good with choice of pastries, eggs, juice and yoghurt.

When we checked in at 4pm, our room was not ready and we had to wait for more than an hour in the small lobby with cold draft each time the doors opened. So not the best experience!

Nevertheless, the staff was very nice and helpful.

title: excellent stay and location
text: We were very pleased with our stay.  The staff at the reception desk was friendly and welcoming, and they kindly assigned us a room not facing the street (I'm very sensitive to street noise etc).  Everything looked new and well designed.  The room was small, but it had everything we needed.  Breakfast is included, served in the basement, a decent but not extravagant selection.  The hotel is just a few blocks from Times Square but  far enough away that you escape the hubbub.

title: Lovely small hotel in a great location
text:
We arrived late on a Tuesday.  Staff was so friendly and informative (Unlike many NYC hotels).  They recommended a great dinner place.  Rooms were larger than many NYC hotels and pricing was reasonable.  The room was kept immaculately.  Beds were comfortable as were the pillows.  We had 5 pillows on a king sized bed.  Elevators ran quickly and quietly.  I would definitely return and recommend this location to my friends.
If I have one small recommendation, the bathroom has terrible lighting for putting on make-up.  This could easily be fixed if they added a small light up retractable mirror on the wall.

Coffee and tea and cookies are available most of  and the time in the lobby,

White the breakfast was free, the breakfast was not good. Part of the reason we visit NYC is for the food, but you can get frozen bagels like those served anywhere in the country.  We wound up going out to breakfast every day.

title: We love it !
text:
Clean room and the fact that all the staff is friendly and helpful.  
It comes with complementary breakfast which is a great help to start your day.
They serve freshly baked cookies in the evening 🥰🥰🥰
The location is excellent , it takes you 10 mins talk to Bryant park , and 5 mins to Broadway if you plan to watch the show.

title: Великолепный отель!
text: Доброжелательный персонал, особенно Diana. Отель новый, не замораживали деньги на карте, хороший завтрак, отличное расположение, в стоимость включены две бутылки воды 0.33 каждый день, очень удобная кровать, уборка была каждый день. Супруга поздравили с Днём Рождения.

title: Great stay!
text: Excellent customer service.  Bushra is super helpful! All the staff were great.  The room is very clean, a bit small, but expected for the price. There was a cold draft in the ventilation in the breakfast area but they fixed it right away. The selections for the breakfast were limited but decent. The bagels and croissants were delicious. Location is close to a lot of places to eat and also close to the subway. I will definitely consider staying here again when I visit NYC.

title: Excellent!!!
text:
Amazing Staff,   rooms are beautiful and comfortable.    Only small issue i had was I requested a wake up call but it was on the morning after clocks changed and I was awaken one hour earlier.....   Everything was great!!!  

Thank you so much

title: Just Opened and a Hidden GEM
text: All I can say is WOW.  I arrived on their second day open and was absolutely amazes at the view I had from one of the top floors.  I have never been to a LaQuinta like this.  the rooms were small but for the price and location this hotel cannot be beat!  I will be back

title: Excellent stay.
text: Just came back from 3 days stay in la quinta  midtown Manhattan.  Had an amazing stay. Right in the middle of Manhattan- walkable distance from times square and subway stations. What impressed us most was the front desk- managed by Diana, John and Mohamud. They were extremely helpful and courteous. Big thanks to them for giving us proper directions and even printouts. Our stay was very pleasant.  Whole heartedly I recommend this place.

title: New hotel needs some adjustments
text: 4 stars because the staff were so nice. 3 stars because I didn't sleep well due to the a/c blowing on the head of the bed and the bathroom fan being permanently on and loud. My brother in a different room had the same issues, although I think he slept better. Otherwise, the bed was very comfortable, room clean, spacious, wi-fi ok, and location good. The hotel appeared to be very recently opened. Spacious room had some wasted space. There was no suitcase stand leaving the floor as the only option. Some people would want a mirror other than the one over the bathroom sink. I had some issues with the light switch and outlet configurations meaning what turned on and off with each switch seemed odd. Could be a great choice if they correct a few things.

title: Calming after the madness of Manhattan.
text: We've had an amazing stay soon after the opening of this newly built hotel. It's amazing how calming the very friendly and smiling staff and well appointed and cleanly designed interior can be after spending your days around the busy streets of Manhattan.
